channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In newly released testimony, Jack Smith defends his investigations into Trump
item.description: Former special counsel Jack Smith spoke with lawmakers behind closed doors in December. That testimony is now public.
item.content:encoded: Former special counsel Jack Smith spoke with lawmakers behind closed doors in December. That testimony is now public.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Mobile crisis teams shut down amid funding troubles
item.description: In recent years, mobile crisis response teams respond to 911 calls about people in mental crisis, to avoid involving police. But some crisis units have now closed for lack of consistent funding.
item.content:encoded: In recent years, mobile crisis response teams respond to 911 calls about people in mental crisis, to avoid involving police. But some crisis units have now closed for lack of consistent funding.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton

item.title: What's ahead for the weight-loss drugs known as GLP-1s in 2026
item.description: There's a new pill and new ways to pay for the weight-loss drugs known as GLP-1s.
item.content:encoded: There's a new pill and new ways to pay for the weight-loss drugs known as GLP-1s.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: How Yo-Yo Ma melds music with the outdoors for the podcast Our Common Nature
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Ana Gonzalez and cellist Yo-Yo Ma about their new podcast Our Common Nature from WNYC, which connects music with nature and place.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Ana Gonzalez and cellist Yo-Yo Ma about their new podcast Our Common Nature from WNYC, which connects music with nature and place.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: California study has lessons for efforts to protect workers from excessive heat
item.description: A new study finds that California's rules protecting workers from excessive heat likely save dozens of lives every year. This comes as the federal government considers national heat-protection rules.
item.content:encoded: A new study finds that California's rules protecting workers from excessive heat likely save dozens of lives every year. This comes as the federal government considers national heat-protection rules.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Thousands of people turn out for NYC Mayor Mamdani's inauguration
item.description: New York City has a new mayor. Zohran Mamdani is the city's first Muslim mayor and a democratic socialist.
item.content:encoded: New York City has a new mayor. Zohran Mamdani is the city's first Muslim mayor and a democratic socialist.
item.dc:creator: Brigid Bergin

item.title: Tips from Life Kit to set you up for success in 2026
item.description: Sometimes life can get in the way of meeting our ambitions. NPR's Life Kit podcast host Marielle Segarra gives us some practical, daily life tips to set us up for success in 2026.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes life can get in the way of meeting our ambitions. NPR's Life Kit podcast host Marielle Segarra gives us some practical, daily life tips to set us up for success in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Israel bans Doctors Without Borders in Gaza. This clinic offers life-saving care
item.description: NPR visits a Doctors Without Borders clinic at risk of closure after Israel bans dozens of aid groups in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: NPR visits a Doctors Without Borders clinic at risk of closure after Israel bans dozens of aid groups in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Author John Green talks about living with obsessive compulsive disorder
item.description: On Wild Card, famous guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author John Green reflects on living with obsessive compulsive disorder.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, famous guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author John Green reflects on living with obsessive compulsive disorder.

item.title: Making a resolution to read more this year? Consider 1992's 'Waiting to Exhale'
item.description: Andrew Limbong and BA Parker from the Books We Love podcast are revisiting Terry McMillan's classic, Waiting to Exhale.
item.content:encoded: Andrew Limbong and BA Parker from the Books We Love podcast are revisiting Terry McMillan's classic, Waiting to Exhale.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong
